item.title: Golang: debugging a running process
item.description: About the problem in general Usually one can debug by changing your program code. This can be called instrumentation: adding debug instrumentation to aid in learning about the bug, and then running the problematic action again. The instrumentation can either be “print statements” or something more elegant like adding debugger breakpoints, or even building your code unchanged but asking the compiler to add debug symbols. But sometimes the problem you’re encountering might happen so rarely that you can’t rebuild (and thus re-run) the binary, but instead you’re left with debugging a running process.
